answers.text: I respectfully disagree, and here's why...

questions.question: During a meeting, your colleague makes a suggestion. How would you politely disagree?

answers.text: Dear [Client Name], Thank you for your email. I'm happy to help...

questions.question: You receive an email with a question from a client. How would you begin your response?

answers.text: I'll get started right away. Would it be possible to clarify the deadline?
There's no way I can finish this by then

questions.question: Your manager asks you to complete a task by the end of the day. It's a large project, and you're unsure if you'll have enough time. What would you say?

answers.text: I understand your frustration. Let's see how I can help

questions.question: You're on the phone with a customer who seems frustrated. What would you say?

answers.text: I'm a little stuck on this. Would you mind taking a look?
Hey, can you do this for me?
I have no idea how to do this

questions.question: You need to ask your coworker for help with a specific task. How would you phrase your request?

answers.text: Attached is the document for your review. Please let me know if you have any questions

questions.question: In an email, you're attaching a document for your colleagues to review. What would you write in the body of the email?
You're writing a short report about a project. What word best describes a successful outcome?

answers.text: Our new product offers innovative features that can benefit your business

questions.question: Your company is launching a new product. How would you describe it to a potential customer?

answers.text: Good morning/afternoon everyone. Today I'd like to discuss...

questions.question: You're giving a presentation to your team. How would you begin?

answers.text: Just a friendly reminder that our deadline is coming up soon. Let's keep working hard!
We're all going to be in trouble if this isn't done

questions.question: An important deadline is approaching. How would you remind your team to stay focused?
